image.altText: A woman with grey short hair wearing a suit.

props.synopsis: Speaking after Australia backed a resolution expanding the rights afforded to the Palestinian United Nations delegation, Foreign Minister Penny Wong says the government no longer believes recognition of Palestinian statehood can only come at the end of an Israel-Palestine peace process.

title.children: Wong says Australia could recognise Palestinian statehood before peace process is complete

image.altText: a scene of a road and grass on two sides with the sky lit up with a wide array of colourful rays.

props.synopsis: The aurora borealis and australis — the northern and southern lights — are captured by photographers around the world as a rare solar weather event colours the skies in magical hues.

title.children: In pictures: Stunning auroras seen around world as geomagnetic storm hits Earth

image.altText: A doctor in scrubs.

props.synopsis: Dr Viet Tran is the deputy director of the Royal Hobart Hospital's emergency department. He's sharing his experiences of emergency medicine in the hope that some of the challenges faced by EDs can be overcome, and better understood by the community.

title.children: 'From the outside it looks very messy': A doctor shares his experiences working in emergency

image.altText: Exterior of a suburban medical clinic.

props.synopsis: An after-hours GP clinic in Hobart's northern suburbs will close at the end of the month. It follows announcements that two other southern Tasmanian clinics are closing, and comes at a time of increasing pressure on hospital emergency departments.

title.children: Another after-hours GP practice in Hobart announces closure

image.altText: Bruce Lehrmann leaves Federal Court in Sydney, surrounded by people, looking serious

props.synopsis: Federal Court Justice Michael Lee on Friday ordered Bruce Lehrmann to pay costs of a higher order than typically seen in defamation cases, but also declared there were "no real winners" in the multi-million-dollar legal battle.

title.children: What happens if Bruce Lehrmann can't afford to pay the massive legal bill coming his way

image.altText: Hawks v Saints

props.synopsis: Hawthorn welcome St Kilda to their home away from home in Tasmania in the first of four big Saturday AFL games. Follow all the action in our live blog.

title.children: Hawks tackle Saints in Launceston to kick off Saturday AFL action

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: QT: Hawks settle for a four-point lead over Saints

image.altText: Phone showing passport photo of father and daughter.

props.synopsis: Last year, a massive blast struck the Gaza hospital in which Ayda was born. It's not the Tasmanian's only connection to the troubled enclave. Her friends and a family member still live there.

title.children: 'Guilty but grateful' to be safe, Gaza-born Ayda watches conflict from afar as Palestinians 'crowdfund for their lives'

image.altText: A woman standing in front of large green leaves smiles

props.synopsis: The single mother exercised regularly and had good blood pressure. It was a shock to wake up in the middle of the night feeling something "catastrophic" was happening.

title.children: Rowena went to bed exceptionally tired. In the middle of the night, she woke to her heart fluttering

image.altText: Tornado rooftop

props.synopsis: Footage of a powerful tornado that tore through the Western Australian city of Bunbury shows it travelling rapidly as it shreds rooftops and damages homes.

title.children: 'Massive pieces of tin in the air': Dramatic video shows freak tornado that lashed through WA town

image.altText: Donald Trump's former lawyer and fixer Michael Cohen smiles as he arrives for a second day of testimony before a grand jury.

props.synopsis: Michael Cohen was once Trump's personal attorney and said he would "take a bullet" for his boss, so what happened to make him flip?

title.children: Michael Cohen has destroyed his life trying to put Donald Trump in jail. Here's why he flipped on his former boss

image.altText: A black sign with green letters reading "For Lease, Apartment 1".

props.synopsis: The ATO says landlords are falling foul of tax rules, but one landlord says it's only human to 'claw back' something from the government.

title.children: The ATO is moving to weed out tax-evading landlords, as it reveals very high rates of tax return errors

image.altText: A tall, balding middle-aged white man in glasses and a suit walks on a seaside footpath with a crowd of people.

props.synopsis: The Princess of Wales stepped away from public duties in March after announcing she had been diagnosed with an undisclosed form of cancer and was undergoing preventative chemotherapy.

title.children: Prince William says Kate is 'doing well', in rare public comment about the princess's condition

image.altText: a woman standing in the living room of her storm damaged home

props.synopsis: Months after a series of freak storms tore through the Gold Coast hinterland, Tammie Fogarty is still waiting for her home to be repaired. She says disaster victims have been left to fend for themselves as the state grapples with a $2.2 billion rebuild.

title.children: Tammie's Gold Coast hinterland home was destroyed at Christmas. She's still waiting to get it fixed

image.altText: Two boys and a girl sit happily holding a viola, cello and trumpet. Their mum and dad sit next to them.

props.synopsis: Music industry heads say families are cutting back on music classes as the cost-of-living crisis bites, while teachers are leaving the profession due to the drop in participation. What does this mean for the future of the industry?

title.children: Why this family refuses to give up music lessons, despite the cost-of-living crunch

image.altText: Novak Djokovic signs autographs at Italian Open.

props.synopsis: World number one Novak Djokovic requires medical attention after being hit by a water bottle following his second-round win against France's Corentin Moutet in Rome.

title.children: Djokovic struck on the head by water bottle while signing autographs at Italian Open

image.altText: An illustration of a woman crouched on a hospital bed with her head in her arms

props.synopsis: If you are an Australian born overseas, speak a language other than English, or you are unemployed, you are more likely to be treated for an acute mental illness against your will.

title.children: We looked at 166,000 psychiatric records. More than half showed people were admitted against their will

image.altText: Composite of a man showing deck fire damage, and the burnt table.

props.synopsis: When farmer Sam Tickner moved a glass vase to a table in his backyard he had no idea he was setting in motion a series of events that would risk his house burning to the ground.

title.children: How a farmer's glass vase turned viral fire hazard after it 'cooked me brand new deck'

image.altText: A multi-storey building higher than other buildings in a commercial area of a CBD.

props.synopsis: The rejection of a major social housing project that would have provided dozens of apartments for vulnerable women over the age of 50 is "one of the poorest decisions" Hobart City Council has made, its mayor says.

title.children: 'One of the poorest decisions': Mayor slams own council after it rejects social housing for vulnerable older women

image.altText: A man in a suit holds a phone up, captured from above on CCTV.

props.synopsis: Zheming Zhang was granted conditional bail in the ACT Magistrates Court following his arrest last week after allegedly extracting $400,000 from international student.

title.children: Man pleads not guilty to impersonating Chinese police officer in Canberra

image.altText: Mother sits on bed holding toy koala up to phone during video call with her children

props.synopsis: Healthcare staffing shortages have led a small Australian town to recruit a Filipino workforce.

title.children: Filipino workers on temporary visas live in tiny rural towns away from their children to take care of our elderly

image.altText: A woman speaks on the phone in shadow.

props.synopsis: WA Police statistics show 1,700 family and domestic offences were recorded in the Kimberley over the first three months of the year.

title.children: With 19 incidents every day, domestic violence rates jump by 50 per cent in far northern Western Australia

image.altText: A woman in a bandaged-style dres sings into a microphone on a stage with an Israeli and a Russian flag either side of her.

props.synopsis: The European Broadcasting Union excluded Russia from the 2022 Eurovision Song Contest after the country invaded Ukraine, so why is Israel still participating in 2024?

title.children: Why is Israel allowed to participate in Eurovision even though Russia was banned?

image.altText: Woman of colour wears yellow headphone, glasses, tan jacket and blue shirt, and holds phone, as she smiles widely and looks up.

props.synopsis: Music can make you happy, sad and everything in between. Tracking those in-between feelings is the secret to harnessing the power of music to change your mood.

title.children: You can use music to change your mood — but there's a catch

image.altText: A band on stage in the foreground and a crowd in the background

props.synopsis: A majority of artists that were part of the cancelled regional festival have not rescheduled playing in Australia this year, adding to the dwindling Australian music festival business.

title.children: Groovin The Moo artists forced to find alternatives after festival axing, if they can

image.altText: A woman sitting on a bed and reading a book, inside a room, with toiletry items in the foreground.

props.synopsis: Widespread alcohol addiction has frayed the social fabric of Alice Springs. But frontline services fear a far greater threat is looming in the outback town – meth.

title.children: Fears of new Alice Springs crime wave as children start using meth

image.altText: A big blue circle with a bright orange blog on the bottom right.

props.synopsis: The Bureau of Meteorology warned level G4 (severe) geomagnetic storm conditions were expected to arrive at Earth from about 8pm AEST on Friday.

title.children: BOM warns of severe geomagnetic storms over weekend

image.altText: man and woman hugging and smiling on the couch

props.synopsis: Sexologist's research shows sex can get better as we age — and a lot of that is to do with prioritising intimacy, being generous, and working with what you've got.

title.children: Eating after and exercising before: Sexologist's top tips for lovemaking in later years

image.altText: Image of a small northern quoll looking directly into the camera

props.synopsis: University researchers are confident that using microscopic genetic modifications will help save the northern quoll from being driven to extinction.

title.children: DNA editing could make northern quolls cane toad-resistant and potentially avoid extinction

image.altText: A female soldier in a helmet and face covering

props.synopsis: Seven months into this war, Israeli authorities have not eliminated Hamas, they have not freed the hostages and they have not restored national security.

title.children: 'There's only been losers and we need to cut our losses': How does Israel actually end this war?

image.altText: Andrew Giles speaks at a press conference at parliament house

props.synopsis: A bid to give the immigration minister extraordinary new powers to deport people and ban others from coming to Australia hangs in the balance, with government and opposition locked in a stand-off.

title.children: 'The ball is in their court': Coalition lists its demands to pass Labor immigration changes

image.altText: A hand hugging a bowl of lentil soup with potato and spinach. On the table are lemons, cumin and sea salt.

props.synopsis: Shorbat Adas bil Hamed is a traditional Lebanese lentil soup with a zesty lemon kick.

title.children: This lentil, lemon and potato soup is delicious — and good for you, too

image.altText: Nina Kennedy competing in the pole vault at the Doha Diamond League meet.

props.synopsis: World pole vault champion Nina Kennedy launches back into the Diamond League in impressive fashion, leading the way as four Olympic-bound Australian athletes achieve top-three finishes in Doha.

title.children: Aussie world champ Kennedy vaults to podium finish at Doha Diamond League meet
